alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 23 at 1:46PM MST until November 24 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of a Trace to 2 inches for the cities of Laramie and Saratoga and 2 to 6 inches on the western edges of each valley. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Upper North Platte River Basin and Laramie Valley including Saratoga, Skyline, Laramie, Bosler, and Rock River. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel. The cold wind chills as low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; Upper North Platte River Basin
